title: Castilian Spanish
summary:
In English, Castilian Spanish can mean the variety of Peninsular Spanish spoken in northern and central Spain, the standard form of Spanish, or Spanish from Spain in general.[1][2][3][4][5][6]
The International Phonetic Association defines Castilian Spanish as the formal Spanish spoken in Castile by educated speakers.[7] In Spanish, the term castellano (Castilian) refers to the Spanish language as a whole, or to the medieval Old Spanish, a predecessor to Early Modern Spanish.
